operation.descriptionCdata:
faf86687-fda4-4f22-bffd-bef395447bb4.description=
This operation takes a reference to a XML file and runs the specified XPath query against the XML read from the file. It returns the results in a delimited list. 
The World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) organization provides the XPath specification (http\://www.w3.org).

Inputs\:
    filename - Absolute path of the XML file to be opened on the RAS.
Example\: c\:\directory\file.xml (Windows RAS)
/directory/file.xml (Non-Windows RAS)
    xpathQuery - The XPath query to be run. See the examples in Notes section below.
    delimiter - The delimiter used to separate values in the returnResult list. 
Default value\: ','.
    parsingFeatures - The list of XML parsing features separated by new line (CRLF). The feature name - value must be separated by empty space. Setting specific features this field could be used to avoid XML security issues like "XML Entity Expansion injection" and "XML External Entity injection". To avoid aforementioned security issues we strongly recommend to set this input to the following values\: 
http\://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl true 
http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-general-entities false 
http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-parameter-entities false 
When the "http\://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl" feature is set to "true" the parser will throw a FATAL ERROR if the incoming document contains a DOCTYPE declaration.  
When the "http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-general-entities" feature is set to "false" the parser will not include external general entities. 
When the "http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-parameter-entities" feature is set to "false" the parser will not include external parameter entities or the external DTD subset. 
If any of the validations fails, the operation will fail with an error message describing the problem. 
Default value\:
http\://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl true
http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-general-entities false
http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-parameter-entities false

Results\:
   returnResult - This is the primary output. It contains the results in a form of a delimited list. If multiple XPaths are defined, the delimiter is added between each value. There is no final delimiter.

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.

Notes\:
1. The XPath query can be specified as a single query. For example\:
/employees/employee[@id\="3"]/*[name()\="name" or name()\="jobDescription" or name()\="salary" or name()\="managerId"]/text()

This returns results in the format ", , , ". For example\:
Goofy,tester,$50,1

2. If more than one XPath query needs to be specified, populate xpathQuery using the XPath concat function. For example\:
concat(/employees/employee[@id\="2"]/name/text(),',',/employees/employee[@id\="2"]/jobDescription/text(),',',/employees/employee[@id\="2"]/managerId/text(),',',/employees/employee[@id\="2"]/salary/text())

This returns results in the format ", , , ". For example\:
Donald Duck,Lead Coder,1,$50

The examples above use the following xml file located on the RAS containing the content below\:


  
    Mickey Mouse
    Chief
    $100
    
  
  
    Donald Duck
    Lead Coder
    $50
    1
  
  
    Goofy
    tester
    $50
    1
  
  
    Pluto
    Coder - grade 1
    $25
    2
operation.name: XPath Query from File
